timeline.message:
Improvements of PSS/E importer:
- supporting both raw and RAW file extensions
- supporting STATUS = 0 of equipments
- modification of header detection
- reading Qmin and Qmax of generating units
- modification of targetQ setter
- better check of the number of windings of transformers

timeline.bodyText: Have you tried what you get in the case of a *.raw|RAW file but the content is not a raw file?
timeline.author: geofjamg

replies.bodyText: Ideally we should had unit tests to cover the different cases (real raw or RAW, fake one)
replies.author: geofjamg

replies.bodyText: raw is a really common extension, used for instance in photography. I think it's a good idea to check if the file is valid or not.
replies.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I have added a test for a better check of the header
replies.author: JB-H

replies.bodyText: I added an additional unit test to cover @mathbagu use case so a "fake" .raw file.
replies.author: geofjamg

timeline.bodyText: Use String.join("|", EXTS) instead of Joiner.on?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: I modified PSSE and UCT import since they were using the same approach
replies.author: JB-H

timeline.bodyText: Is this catch OK? There is probably to many try/catch level where only one is sufficient?
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.message:
Improvements of PSS/E importer:
- supporting both raw and RAW file extensions
- supporting STATUS = 0 of equipments
- modification of header detection
- reading Qmin and Qmax of generating units
- modification of targetQ setter
- better check of the number of windings of transformers

Signed-off-by: Jean-Baptiste Heyberger <jbheyberger@gmail.com>
